pullRequest.body:
- fetch the whole repository (with history) when checking it out
- fix a repeated typo mathlib -> mathlib4
- the workflow token has been switched to a bot account
- also silence a noisy `git fetch` step which was filling up the logs with unrelated branch names

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6c9952d619](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13498/commits/6c9952d61988168c487999e575f6193f42b2013c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

OK, it looks like the workflow is able to successfully open PRs (and even approve them automatically with bors powers)! I *think* once we revert the "on: push" back to "schedule: cron", this is almost in good enough shape for merging. (All that is left is writing a new title / description, which I can do tomorrow, along with switching the token so that the PRs come from a bot account rather than mine.)

I have switched the token in the`UPDATE_NOLINTS_TOKEN` secret again. Note that the new token only has the `public_repo` scope. The token used earlier for testing here also had the "workflow" scope, which was necessary to push to this branch, which modifies workflow files. Because of this, further testing commits to this branch won't work, but the new token should work for scheduled update-nolints PRs (which should only ever touch `scripts/nolints.json` and `scripts/style-exceptions.txt` and in particular never need to touch any workflow files).

Thanks @grunweg for your effort on this. I think this PR will be ready as soon as #16301 is in and we fix the trivial merge conflict that might pop up here. (I did notice that I forgot to give write access to the bot account, but that is done now too.)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10635154956/job/29484121596)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10635154956/job/29484122624)

nodes.body:
Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thanks a ton for your help. This basically looks good to me.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Actually, I'm not sure this is the best solution, as even if this allows the workflow to proceed, the job will get a red x and notify whoever modified the workflow last.  We could add `continue-on-error` to the job (as we do in the `bot_fix_style_*` workflows), but that will cover up errors in other steps of the workflow.

@grunweg Would it make sense to have `lint-style` not return an nonzero exit code when linting errors are detected when run in `--update` or `--fix` modes?

I think it makes sense, yes: update or fix mode are *supposed* to fix errors (so returning zero if something changed seems morally fine); the lint-style check runs without these arguments, so is not affected
Is this needed? (It probably doesn't hurt either, though.)
I've removed it to minimize the diff.
Is this change needed? It probably doesn't hurt, though.

Yeah, I think you may have added it for debugging purposes at the beginning of this branch. I'll clean it up in another commit. (I want to make the `git fetch` step less noisy since it's currently spamming the log with a line for every open branch in this repo)
Reminder to change this before merging :-)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(CI): make the `update-nolints` workflow work

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

OK, it looks like the workflow is able to successfully open PRs (and even approve them automatically with bors powers)! I *think* once we revert the "on: push" back to "schedule: cron", this is almost in good enough shape for merging. (All that is left is writing a new title / description, which I can do tomorrow, along with switching the token so that the PRs come from a bot account rather than mine.)

I have switched the token in the`UPDATE_NOLINTS_TOKEN` secret again. Note that the new token only has the `public_repo` scope. The token used earlier for testing here also had the "workflow" scope, which was necessary to push to this branch, which modifies workflow files. Because of this, further testing commits to this branch won't work, but the new token should work for scheduled update-nolints PRs (which should only ever touch `scripts/nolints.json` and `scripts/style-exceptions.txt` and in particular never need to touch any workflow files).
Thanks a ton for your help. This basically looks good to me.

Thanks @grunweg for your effort on this. I think this PR will be ready as soon as #16301 is in and we fix the trivial merge conflict that might pop up here. (I did notice that I forgot to give write access to the bot account, but that is done now too.)

Thanks :tada:
